channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How the Women of ‘Too Much’ Made Lena Dunham’s Rom-Com Just Right

item.title: Hershey CEO’s exit knocks the number of women running Fortune 500 companies
item.description: Michele Buck will retire from the chocolate-maker—and her successor is the CEO of Wendy's.

item.title: AI is turbocharging worker productivity but it’s also wreaking havoc on their mental health
item.description: New research is a “flashing red light for CHROs.”

item.title: The rules for paying taxes on tips and overtime are changing thanks to Trump’s Big Beautiful Bill. Here’s what to expect
item.description: More information on exactly what jobs the provisions apply to will be made available in the months ahead.

item.title: Trump Got the Green Light to Fire Federal Workers. Now, They Wait.

item.title: Why two-time founder and MacArthur Genius Daphne Koller sees a future where humans “create together with the machines”
item.description: "The future has to be getting people to partner well and create together with the machines," Koller told Fortune.

item.title: Gen Z are ‘overemployed,’ holding down 5 jobs and earning over $3k a day—and it’s totally legal

item.title: French Police Raid National Rally Over Campaign Finances
item.description: The authorities said they were investigating whether the nationalist, anti-immigrant party broke France’s campaign-finance rules.
